title: A diferença entre o Nerd de hoje e dos anos 70
Dê um StartUp na sua Vida
Oficina de Arduino
description: Arduino é É uma plataforma de prototipagem eletrônica de de placa única, projetada com um microcontrolador. O Arduino é um dispositivo microcontrolado aberto, um processador, capaz de “sentir” o ambiente através de suas entradas por meio de sensores variados, processar esses dados via programas inteligentes e afetar o seu entorno controlando e “agindo” sobre o ambiente. Essa ação pode ser realizada por meio de motores e atuadores que possibilitam, por exemplo, ligar ou desligar luzes e componentes. Além disso, o Arduino é capaz de se comunicar com os computadores (Windows, Linux ou MacOS).

title: Pilotando Drones
description: Cada vez mais populares e acessíveis os dispositivos, cada vez mais criativos se tornam os seus usos. Equipes de jornalismo estão usando helicópteros usados para fazer tomadas aéreas em reportagens e coberturas de eventos em geral, por drones, ou até das filmagens em eventos esportivos e shows, que usam drones equipados com câmeras de alta qualidade para registrar as imagens.

title: INTRODUÇÃO A LINGUAGEM RUBY
description: Ruby é uma linguagem dinâmica, open source com foco na simplicidade e na produtividade. Tem uma sintaxe elegante de leitura natural e fácil escrita.

title: Entendendo o Impacto social do Mobile.
description: O Mobile tem transformado não só a vidas das pessoas,também mercados e indústrias inteiras. Ele mudou toda a jornada de compra e decisão. Mas enquanto os consumidores saíram na frente, o investimento das marcas tem ficado para trás. Vamos conversar sobre como o mobile pode ajudar as marcas a engajarem mais seus clientes

title: Oficina de Scratch
description: O Scratch é um software que se utiliza de blocos lógicos, e itens de som e imagem, para você desenvolver suas próprias histórias interativas, jogos e animações, além de compartilhar de maneira online suas criações. O Scratch é um projeto do grupo Lifelong Kindergarten no Media Lab do MIT (Instituto de Tecnologia de Massachusets), onde foi idealizado por Mitchel Resnick. Ele foi projetado especialmente para idades entre 8 e 16 anos, mas é usado por pessoas de todas as idades. O Scratch é usado em mais de 150 países, está disponível em mais de 40 idiomas, e é fornecido gratuitamente para os principais sistemas operacionais (Windows, Linux e Mac).

title: Scalable Microservices with gRPC, Kubernetes, and Containers
description:
Microservices and Containers are a great mix, but if you want to get serious about using them together then you need to start shopping for a Cluster Management and Container Orchestration Platform. It just so happens there's already an extremely popular, Open Source, Cross Cloud Platform called Kubernetes. You'll also need something to wire them together, maybe something that offers high performance RPCs, but also provides a toolset to generate services and clients in multiple languages. gRPC is a language and platform-neutral RPC framework, based on HTTP/2 and Protobuf, used to build highly performant and scalable APIs.

In this talk, we’ll demo the core concepts of gRPC and Kubernetes, and show you how to combine these two technologies to create scalable and performant microservices rooted in lessons learned from Google’s experience!

title: Redefining PaaS: Managed container based apps on Google App Engine
description:
Are you building the next big idea? Are you part of a team that is focused on streamlined dev/test/production deployments? Are you a bit more “dev” than “ops”? If so, be sure to come by and check out this talk that focuses on maximizing developer productivity through the use of microservice based architectures and container technology in conjunction with Google App Engine.

We'll look at new and enhanced features of App Engine and walk through the staged deployment of both a simple application and a more complicated microservices based architecture. We'll also look at how App Engine has evolved from it's original sandboxed runtime environment to what it is today, a next generation platform for building and deploying modern day applications.

title: Material Design Magic
description:
1. Material Design Magic
2. Work with colours, typography and custom branding
3. Frameworks for MD Style
4. Issues, tricks and Best cases.

title: Continuous Delivery with Ease
description: Do you create builds for your client frequently? Maybe every day? That’s good, because you can get feedback early and often… unless you do that manually, pushing APKs via mail or to some app testing platform via browser. Look back at the time spent on these tedious tasks. How would you feel if you could spend less time and do even more at the same time? I will show you, how easy it is to set things up, not to spend even a minute a day to create builds for your testers. We will look at all the requirements for that and we will go as far as enabling business people to decide when to publish new version of your amazing application literally with a push of a button.

title: Let's play Dart!
description:
Dart is a language for the web by Google which is object oriented with optional types. You can use Dart to build great apps for the client-side, server-side and command line.

Come to listen to my story why I love Dart and why it makes me so much productive!

title: Polymer vs other libraries
description: Most modern front-end JavaScript libraries provide support for component based development. Components help separate large applications into standalone building blocks with specified communication API. Let's compare Polymer elements with components from React, Angular, Ember and Backbone.

title: Bluetooth Low Energy and iBeacon development for Android
description: iBeacon is a new technology created by Apple. iBeacon uses a Bluetooth low energy signal, which Android 4.3+ devices can detect. Some fairly significant improvements were announced at Google I/O 2014 for improved BLE support in Android Lollipop. We will discuss different implementations for devices prior to 5.0, and for 5.0 and higher.  During our talk you will learn how to implement background beacon scanning, how to improve battery life (and how to choose between fast beacon detection and longer battery life). Also we'll discuss, on how to turn your android device into multiple iBeacon transmitters. Allowing a single Android device to act as multiple iBeacons opens up a huge number of interesting possibilities.

title: Students & Google: how not to vanish in the crowd
description: Most students believe that getting a job at Google is some kind of 'Mission Impossible'. Fortunately, you don't need superpower for this. In her talk Anna will tell you about the opportunities for students at Google and will share some tips on how to apply, keep calm and succeed.
